title: Google ushers in era of 'quantum supremacy': Here's what that means
text:
Google researchers claim to have made a major breakthrough in quantum computing after creating a processing chip which can perform calculations significantly faster than classic supercomputers computers.

In a paper published in the journal Nature, Google's researchers said there had been a "dramatic increase in speed" with its Syacmore processor, compared to a classic supercomputer.

Its chip took around 200 seconds to perform a calculation, that would have taken a classical supercomputer 10,000 years to complete.

This, the researchers said, indicated they had realised what is known as "quantum supremacy", and since the discovery, made last spring, Google had been working on near-term applications,...
description: Google researchers claim to have made a major breakthrough in quantum computing after creating a processing chip which can perform calculations significantly faster than classic supercomputers computers.
